result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamar Lenoir was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Supervision by the Mental Health Unit.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all supervision fees  as determined by the DOC.
*Pay all applicable costs and surcharges. 
*Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Defendant may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if conditions are met under Stats. section 165.77(4).

*No firearms/weapons.
*Due to this DV conviction defendant may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*NO CONTACT with victim, unless the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
*Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

*Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
*Successfully complete:
"Batterers Intervention"
Any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

*Participate  in AODA Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*In-patient treatment if possible.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Time is stayed pending probation review on 09/11/15 to Branch 38.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamar Lenoir

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lamar Lenoir in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Lamar Lenoir in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Received in writing and filed:  Probation Status Report from Matthew Polsin
probation/parole agent. ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.

Defendant Lamar Lenoir in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Lamar Lenoir in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 4.  
AS TO COUNT 2:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days consecutive in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/11/15.
-Supervision by the Mental Health Unit, Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
  In-patient treatment if possible.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.    Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse..  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Elaine H.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lamar Lenoir in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  
Defendant Lamar Lenoir in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
